channel.title: Linux capable clients
channel.description: anyone have one? :) debugging for me would be a lot easier if i could log in to server from same system, and not have to worry about a broken colon key on my laptop instead.

item.title: Linux capable clients
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

well you gave me where to fix it, but it says the static error message, making it static it goes away. but i still cant get it to load :\ i am new to linux so these things are still rather confusing to me >.> what what is user.home? is that home/MYNAME? because the folder “home” i cant paste to ._. it is owned by “root” lol.

Starting up Homiescape's Client Error: loaderror Starting up Client 20

my error

Read full topic

item.title: Linux capable clients
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

matzie:

only if there are no paths in them. it has to find your cache from somewhere! and the client i has has been obfusterfucked =\ so there is no editing it to work for me.

signlink/signlink.java

public String findcachedir() {
    return String.format("%s/%s/", System.getProperty("user.home"), ".cache_name_here");
}

Works everywhere. Just be sure to move the cache to your home directory.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux capable clients
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

matzie:

anyone have one? debugging for me would be a lot easier if i could log in to server from same system, and not have to worry about a broken colon key on my laptop instead.

All clients are “linux capable”. They run on Java, which is platform-independent.
